column4: Can any one confirm a thing for me, running ubuntu i386 and trying to make virtual box run win 7 x64 getting a message that my cpu cant handle x64 VT-x/AMD-v is enabled both in settings and in bios - Any help would be cool :)
because i got win 7 x64 as this is a alienware M15x x64
well i got random logouts in ubuntu x64
and tried now i386 as some forums told that would make it go away... tried allso changing my format from ext4 to ext3

A common misconception about 64bit hardware: Having 64bit hardware/cpu does NOT mean you have VT-X/AMD-V as well, in other words: yes you can run a 64bit OS on 64bit hardware as a HOST, but a 64bit GUEST NEEDS VT-X/AMD-V to be active and enabled.
take a look at http://forums.virtualbox.org/viewtopic.php?t=8669
np... :) ... I've never tried using 64os on i386 structure
that should be powerful enough... do you have the option turned on?
then my guess is you need x64 host to run x64 guest... but am not that experienced
oh wait, win7 is reporting that you don't have 64bit processor?
it's easy to check, download some 64bit linux image and try booting that... :)
will see if that will do to... but as i sad, when i had ubuntu 10.4 x64 installed it worked with win 7 x64
am not well experienced in that matter, so your guess is good as mine...
thanks do for trying to help :)
gah, I wish I was able to help... sorry about that...
yes?
random "logouts" can be X crashes... did you check the logs?
i did... cant find any thing spes... tried to force a logout with with firefox < error.txt and browse see if that got any but no such luck
couldent find any info there to help me, but yeah i think something is making the X crash
tail -f /var/log/Xorg.0.log > error.txt will try that command and browse and see if i get an logout... might be luck and get some info be for it crash me!!
you can always ctrl+alt+f1 :D and go to a system terminal without X :) ... and do that there... if X crashes, that terminal remains
you use alt+f7 (or f8) to get back :D
